sentences.en: a delay in the publication of the exam results
Be conscientious and make a good job of publication.
He saw the publication of this book as an embarrassing invasion of his privacy.
sentences.cn: 他觉得这本书的出版侵犯了他的私生活，让他十分难堪。

sentences.en: He superintended the publication of a score of good plays.
sentences.cn: 他监制了许多好的戏剧.

sentences.en: Publication dates are given in brackets after each title.
sentences.cn: 出版日期括于书名后面。

sentences.en: The guide is being translated into several languages for publication near Christmas.
sentences.cn: 该手册正被译成数种语言，将在临近圣诞节时出版。

sentences.en: The magazine started [ began ] ( its ) publication in January, 1927.
sentences.cn: 该杂志于1927年1月 创刊.

sentences.en: The publication comes as the answer to an acute demand.
sentences.cn: 这一出版物是为满足急需而出版的.

sentences.en: The publication of his collected poems was approaching the status of an event.
sentences.cn: 他的诗集的出版可能说是一件大事。

sentences.en: the publication of his first novel
The Tundra Times, a weekly newspaper in Alaska, ceased publication this week.
sentences.cn: 阿拉斯加的周报《苔原时报》本周停刊了。

sentences.en: They don't think this article is suitable for publication.
sentences.cn: 他们认为这篇文章不宜发表.

sentences.en: This book is ready for publication.
sentences.cn: 这本书已准备好,随时可以出版.

sentences.en: This manuscript is so good that it deserves publication.
sentences.cn: 这份稿子太好了,值得刊载.

sentences.en: Three editors handled the work of revising the articles for publication.
sentences.cn: 3位编辑负责文章的修订出版工作。

words.tran_cn: 公众的；政府的；公用的；公立的
出版；发行（publish的现在分词形式）；发表

trans.tran_en: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to stores to be sold
